The remove command; Used to remove files, directories, symbolic links etc. from the file system.
The copy command; Used to copy directories, files, or file groups.
The move command; Used to move directories, files, or file groups within a file system.

Allows for files to be securely copied between servers.

Used for preprocessing, compilation, assembly and linking of source code to generate an executable file.

Determines which parts of a large program need to be re-compiled, and then issues the commands necessary to recompile them.
Used to list the currently running processes and their PIDs along with some other information depends on different options.

Used to change the access mode of a file.
Reads data from file and gives their content as output. Helps to create, view, concatenate files.

Used to display information related to file systems about total space and available space.
